text: Kim Chang-dong (; born February 11, 2000), better known by his in-game name Canna (), is a South Korean professional League of Legends player. He is a top laner player who currently plays for T1. He made his debut on KeSPA Cup 2019. He was a trainee of T1 before being promoted to the team. == Early life == Canna was born on February 11, 2000. His hometown is in Andong City, North Gyeongsang, South Korea. His role model is Khan. His in-game name was based on his favourite anime character, Kanna Kamui, from Miss Kobayashi's Dragon Maid. == Career == === Season 9 === During his time as trainee, he and four other trainees from T1, including Ellim, Mask, Gumayushi and Kuri had competed in the 2019 LoL Amateur Tournament. The team was called 'T1 rookies', and they had successfully won the tournament. On November 26, 2019, T1 announced that Canna will be joining as part of the roster. His first game after the announcement was against Gen.G during KeSPA Cup 2019, and his first champion used was Aatrox, which he won. === Season 10 === He played his first LCK game on February 7, 2020, against Hanwha Life Esports. He and his team finished the split at second place, which qualified them to the second round of playoffs. On April 25, 2020, he and his team successfully won the LCK Spring finals. This was his first LCK title, which made him a 'Royal Roader'. == Accomplishments == {| class="wikitable" |- !Year !Team !Event !Place |- | rowspan="5" |2020 | rowspan="5" |T1 |KeSPA Cup 2019 | style="background:#c96;" |3rd–4th |- |League of Legends Champions Korea Spring 2020 | style="background:gold;" |1st |- |2020 Mid-Season Cup |7th–8th |- |League of Legends Champions Korea Summer 2020 |5th |- |Korea Regional Finals 2020 |style="background:silver;" |2nd |} == References == == Notes == == External links == * Category:Living people Category:South Korean esports players Category:2000 births Category:SK Telecom T1 players Category:League of Legends top lane players Category:Twitch (service) streamers
title: Canna (gamer)
